titleStmt.title: [Tasso, Aminta:] From the AMINTA of TASSO.
titleStmt.author: Anne Finch (née Kingsmill), countess of Winchilsea

publicationStmt.idno: Anne Finch (née Kingsmill), countess of Winchilsea_tasso-aminta-from-the-aminta-o

bibl.title: [Tasso, Aminta:] From the AMINTA of TASSO.
bibl.author: Anne Finch (née Kingsmill), countess of Winchilsea

front.head: [Tasso, Aminta:] From the AMINTA of TASSO.

lg.l: THO' we, of small Proportion see
Yet if her Sting behind she leaves,
No Ease th' envenom'd Flesh receives.
less to Sight than is this Fly,
In a soft conceal'd can lie;
Can the most subtil Sight beguile,
Hid in the Dimples of a
But if from thence a Dart he throw,
How sure, how mortal is the Blow
How helpless all the Pow'r of Art
To bind, or to restore the Heart!
